titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Traugott Lawler Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Christine Connolly

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 07:28

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: This collection consists of material related to a two volume set of Jankyn's Book of Wikked Wyves , edited by Ralph Hanna III and Traugott Lawler as part of the Modern Language Association's Chaucer Library Series. In the first volume, Hanna and Lawler presented comprehensive versions of the three medieval texts that comprised Jankyn's "Book of Wikked Wives" which is referenced in "The Wife of Bath's Tale" in The Canterbury Tales . In the second volume, Hanna and Lawler presented the known contemporary commentaries on one of the three texts, Walter Map's "Dissuasio Valerii," or "The Letter of Valerius to His Friend Ruffinus, Dissuading Him from Marrying." The bulk of the material consists of transcriptions, translations, glosses and reproductions of portions of the commentaries, which were used during the production of volume two. It includes some material not in the published work. The collection also includes drafts of volume one and correspondence related to the project.

langmaterial.language: The materials are in English, Latin, and Middle English (1100-1500).

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Chaucer, Geoffrey, -1400 ( Canterbury tales, Wife of Bath's tale)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Traugott Lawler Papers (MS 2023). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Traugott Lawler received his B.A. from College of the Holy Cross in 1958, an M.A. from University of Wisconsin in 1962, and a Ph.D. from Harvard University in 1966. He was a member of the Yale faculty from 1966 to 1972, taught at Northwestern University from 1972 to 1982, and returned to Yale in 1981.

In 1981, Lawlor and Ralph Hanna were asked to take over a project on the sources of the "Book of Wikked Wyves" mentioned by the Wife of Bath in the Canterbury Tales . Originally begun by Yale Professor Karl Young (1879-1943) in the 1930s, the work was continued by his student, Robert Armstrong Pratt (1907-1987). The notes, microfilm and other research materials collected by Young and Pratt were divided between Hanna and Lawler and served as the basis for the two volume set of Jankyn's Book of Wikked Wyves, , with volume one, The Primary Texts , published in 1997 and volume 2, Seven Commentaries on Walter Map's "Dissuasio Valerii" , published in 2014.

A medievalist scholar and an expert on William Langland, his other published works include The One and the Many in the Canterbury Tales and The Parisiana Poetria of John of Garland , as well as numerous journal articles. After his retirement from Yale in 2005, Lawlor continued his academic work as emeritus professor of English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of material related to a two volume set of Jankyn's Book of Wikked Wyves , edited by Ralph Hanna III and Traugott Lawler as part of the Modern Language Association's Chaucer Library Series. In the first volume, Hanna and Lawler presented comprehensive versions of the three medieval texts that comprised Jankyn's "Book of Wikked Wives" which is referenced in "The Wife of Bath's Tale" in The Canterbury Tales . In the second volume, Hanna and Lawler presented the known contemporary commentaries on one of the three texts, Walter Map's "Dissuasio Valerii," or "The Letter of Valerius to His Friend Ruffinus, Dissuading Him from Marrying." The bulk of the material consists of transcriptions, translations, glosses and reproductions of portions of the commentaries, which were used during the production of volume two. It includes some material not in the published work. The collection also includes drafts of volume one and correspondence related to the project.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material is arranged as received from the creator of the records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This material includes correspondence, draft of introduction, glosses, notes, texts, and translations.

did.unittitle: Lewis comments on a late draft

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letter, dated 5 March 1984, to George B. Young, briefly describes the actions taken and plans for the continuation of the "Book of Wikked Wyves" project begun by Karl Young which Lawler and Ralph Hanna had taken over from Robert Pratt in 1981.
